content: Last night, the core team planned out a new IG infrastructure. It's our plan to execute on that over the next few weeks. One consequence of this is that the existing IGs will all need to bre redone - that is, the way they are edited and published needs to change, but not the content
Here's a list of the Implementation Guides, along with the committers I have volunteered to rebuild the guides once the process is ready

cqmf = Bryn
ihe = ??
uslab = Eric
sdc = Lloyd
sdcde = Lloyd
daf = Grahame
ehrsrle = ?
qicore = ?
cqif = Bryn
hspc = Grahame/Nathan
nehta = Grahame
argonaut = Grahame
gao = Keith
digitizeiom = Bryn
ccda = Rick
pcd = ??
cts2 = Bryn
payerextract = Bryn
please review, and who should do the ones I have noone for?
I can do PCD... although I am also trying to convert to a Resource..
John - nothing to do for several weeks at this piont
EHRSRLE = lloyd. qicore=Bryn
http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=Proposed_new_FHIR_IG_build_Process
OK, I like it. When can I test it and where can I download the JAR file? ;-)
probably available early next week
https://talk.jekyllrb.com/t/separating-generated-and-version-controlled-content/2442
comments welcome from anyone who wants to use Jekyll. It works, now, but it's painful sorting through the source material seperating edited from generated

Question on the build process now that this exists. I'm making some changes to Encounter (and 1 to Patient) that will be breaking and need to update the examples (happy to do it) but wanted to be sure that they are all still included in the build and I'll know that I got them all?

for now, nothing has been moved out of the build. However, if you change DAF examples, can you clone the changes into DAF2 please. If, on the other hand, you have to change the DAF profiles.... that's a different problem
I have that problem too. Datatype changed, and another fieldname will change.
code -> Coding
actually, daf, you just copy the output profiles from publish/daf into DAF2
so take the xml/html content from the publish/daf folder and check it into guides/daf2?
just for profiles
thanks

only file I ended up replacing was daf/daf-encounter.profile.xml --> daf2/resoures/daf-encounter.xml
This had the diff for the change that I made, and also now includes all the element ids.
Does this sound right?
yes thanks

Hi @Grahame Grieve , I believe I'm going to be the person migrating the CGWG Google Doc IG to an "official" FHIR IG. Could you please point me to all the documentation on how to do this given your new IG infrastructure?

I understand the "official" FHIR IG has to be committed before July 24th. What happens if we miss the deadline? We will have a Google Doc (for example) before then but I'm not completely sure about its migration to the FHIR current build.
the only document there is at the moment is http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=Proposed_new_FHIR_IG_build_Process
and there is a worked example in \build\guides\daf2 - or see the test example in \build
in \build\tests\ig
